channel.title: Church of God Guthrie Assembly Meeting 2023
channel.itunes:subtitle: Select sermons from churchofgodpreaching.com
channel.itunes:author: Craig Dickson
channel.itunes:summary: Sermons from the Church of God Oklahoma Assembly Meeting in Guthrie, Oklahoma in December 2023. Audio provided by churchofgodpreaching.com
channel.description: Sermons from the Church of God Oklahoma Assembly Meeting in Guthrie, Oklahoma in December 2023

item.title: We Reap What We Sow
item.itunes:title: We Reap What We Sow
item.itunes:author: Dan Doolittle
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/22/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Dan Doolittle delivers a sermon reflecting on lessons from King Solomon's life. It analyzes how even the wisest person failed to tend his 'vineyard' by neglecting humility and kindness over time, leading to conflict and division. Despite wisdom to counsel others, Solomon did not heed warnings and planted seeds of arrogance reaped in bitterness. Core themes cover the universal laws of sowing and reaping, need for self-reflection, seeking God's wisdom, and living with love and humility daily to bear good fruit.
item.description: Bro. Dan Doolittle delivers a sermon reflecting on lessons from King Solomon's life. It analyzes how even the wisest person failed to tend his 'vineyard' by neglecting humility and kindness over time, leading to conflict and division. Despite wisdom to counsel others, Solomon did not heed warnings and planted seeds of arrogance reaped in bitterness. Core themes cover the universal laws of sowing and reaping, need for self-reflection, seeking God's wisdom, and living with love and humility daily to bear good fruit.

item.title: God Has An Answer
item.itunes:title: God Has An Answer
item.itunes:author: Ivan Eck
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/23/2023
item.itunes:summary: Bro. Ivan Eck delivers a sermon focusing on themes of spiritual hunger, the importance of godly association, leaving worldly things behind to follow Christ, spending intentional time with God, and being fishers of men. Key points include how Christ's words can satisfy spiritual longings, the need to influence younger generations, Peter's miraculous catch of fish and subsequent commitment to discipleship, and exhortations to commune with God as the early Christians did.
item.description: Bro. Ivan Eck delivers a sermon focusing on themes of spiritual hunger, the importance of godly association, leaving worldly things behind to follow Christ, spending intentional time with God, and being fishers of men. Key points include how Christ's words can satisfy spiritual longings, the need to influence younger generations, Peter's miraculous catch of fish and subsequent commitment to discipleship, and exhortations to commune with God as the early Christians did.

item.title: Unto You
item.itunes:title: Unto You
item.itunes:author: churchofgodpreaching.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Guthrie Assembly Meeting 12/30/2023
item.itunes:summary:
Bro. Marty Clevenger delivers a sermon reflecting on the meaning of Christmas and the gift of salvation through Christ. Bro. Marty explores differing perspectives from outright rejection to wholehearted embrace of Christmas traditions. He emphasizes moving beyond debates over dates, origins or even outward observances to focus on accepting Christ’s gift of redemption, forgiveness and healing for ourselves. Through illustrations of a wild raccoon, tangled buck deer antlers, broken cisterns in a thirsty land, and the crucifixion scene, the message highlights parallels like fighting the gift or laboring to save ourselves versus simply receiving God’s grace.
Scriptures referenced: Philippians 1, Luke 2, John 3, Jeremiah
item.description:
Bro. Marty Clevenger delivers a sermon reflecting on the meaning of Christmas and the gift of salvation through Christ. Bro. Marty explores differing perspectives from outright rejection to wholehearted embrace of Christmas traditions. He emphasizes moving beyond debates over dates, origins or even outward observances to focus on accepting Christ’s gift of redemption, forgiveness and healing for ourselves. Through illustrations of a wild raccoon, tangled buck deer antlers, broken cisterns in a thirsty land, and the crucifixion scene, the message highlights parallels like fighting the gift or laboring to save ourselves versus simply receiving God’s grace.
Scriptures referenced: Philippians 1, Luke 2, John 3, Jeremiah
